alert.note: Alert for Annette Island; City and Borough of Wrangell; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 23 at 1:53PM AKST until February 25 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY... .A strengthening low with embedded waves will move into the NE gulf Thursday evening with an associated front moving over the panhandle Friday. Dry snow will spread from north to south across the panhandle. The snow will largely fall in two separate waves. A first, and weaker, wave will move through during Thursday night and early Friday morning. A brief lull may be possible Friday morning for some locations before a much stronger wave moves into the panhandle, bringing with it substantially more snow. Some uncertainty exists regarding snow totals due to limited moisture available, particularly for parts of the northern and central inner channels. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates will be Friday evening through early Saturday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM FRIDAY TO 9 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Petersburg Borough, Prince of Wales Island, City and Borough of Wrangell, Ketchikan Gateway Borough and Annette Island including Metlakatla. * WHEN...From 9 AM Friday to 9 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light, dry, snow will fall during the day Friday, then greater rates are expected Friday evening and Friday night. Lower amounts along western Prince of Wales Island near sea level. Some mixing with rain is possible late Friday night along the outer coast of Prince of Wales and Annette Islands. Rates begin to diminish early Saturday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

area.areaDesc: Annette Island; City and Borough of Wrangell; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island
